item.name: admin sets a role as default

request.description:
this is to set a role as default
required body content:
        'id'=>requried
the header must also carry Authorization: Bearer <token>
response=>{
on success...'success' => true,
            'message'=>'role set as default successfully'
on failure...'success' => false,
            'message' => 'Sorry, role could not be added'
}

header.name: access-control-allow-credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: access-control-allow-headers
header.value: Origin, Content-Type, Accept, Authorization, X-Request-With, cache-control
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: access-control-allow-methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: cache-control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: content-type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: host
header.description: Custom header

header.name: x-powered-by
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

header.name: x-ratelimit-limit
header.description: Custom header

header.name: x-ratelimit-remaining
header.description: Custom header

item.name: admin views a single user profile details

request.description:
this is to get single users  
required body content:
        'id'=>requried

response=>{
on success..."success"=>true,
                "data"=>$users,
                'image_directory'=>"image directory",
on failure...'success' => false,
            'message' => 'Sorry, user with id could not be found'
}

the header must also carry admin Authorization: Bearer <token>

request.description:
this is to ban a user it simply changes user status from zero to one 
required body content:
        'id'=>requried
the header must also carry Authorization: Bearer <token>
response=>{
on success..."success"=>true,
message=>'user banned successfully'
               
on failure...'success' => false,
            'message' => 'user ban was not successfully'
}

item.name: add  a profile picture for the admin

request.description:
this displays all the roles with or without pagination...if the
last parameter which is the pagination is not added it fetches all the roles without pagination and if it is added it paginates all contents dependent on the pagination details..

this displays a specific role with the id passed as the paramater...
the header must also carry admin Authorization: Bearer <token>

this is to add a new role
required body content:
'       rolename' => 'required',
        'isdefault' => 'required',
the header must also carry Authorization: Bearer <token>
response=>{
on success...'success' => true,
            'role' => new role added
on failure...'success' => false,
            'message' => 'Sorry, role could not be added'
}

this is to update a role
required body content:
        'id'=>requried
         'rolename' => 'required',
        'isdefault' => 'required',
the header must also carry Authorization: Bearer <token>
response=>{
on success...'success' => true,
            'role' => role updated successfully
on failure...'success' => false,
            'message' => 'Sorry, role could not be added'
}
